page.title: 06WEST FELTON SCHOOL BUS
page.content: On Monday, April 29th, the Chairman of the Parent's Support Group, Mr P.Brown, was interviewed by shropshire Radio concerning the non-attendance at school of eight pupils. Mr Brown said that they were being educated at home by their parents until the Education Authority re-instated transport for them. He explained that due to the Authority replacing a mini-bus with a taxi,the children would have to walk to school along the busy A.5. trunk road or along lonely country lanes. James Carr,aged 5, was also interviewed and said "Walking so far makes my legs ache". On Tuesday B.B.C.Television came to yhe school. The Headmaster was interviewed and film taken of Class 2, highlighting the vacant seats of the absent children.
